name: Cueyatl Sea Priest
movement: swim 30 ft., climb 20 ft., walk 30 ft.
description: A small, cunning humanoid adept in both aquatic and jungle environments, characterized by its leather armor and a trident.
memorable: The Cueyatl Sea Priest's ability to communicate with sea life and its substantial poison damage makes it a unique and formidable adversary.
goals: To dominate aquatic environments and use cunning strategies against enemies.
relations: May associate with other aquatic creatures and be encountered with sea monsters.
environment: Typically found in aquatic and jungle settings.
strengths: Advantages in stealth within jungle terrain and the ability to breathe underwater.
weaknesses: Relatively average in physical strength and combat skills.
attacks: Utilizes a trident that delivers piercing damage plus potent poison damage.
most_powerful_ability: Able to communicate with amphibious creatures, providing tactical advantages in water.
skills: Skilled in medicine and religion, with a notable proficiency in medicine.
additional_information: Has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks in jungle terrain.
Possesses a standing leap ability for impressive movement versatility.
Can cast spells with a focus on communication and environmental control.
The poison damage from its trident can be deadly for unprepared foes.
Possesses an Amphibious ability to adapt in both land and water.
spellcasting: 2nd-level spellcaster with a focus on utility and communication spells.
test_queries: small humanoid that can breathe underwater
cunning sea priest with poison attacks
aquatic creature that speaks with sea life
jungle camouflaged humanoid with spellcasting abilities
evasive priest using a trident in combat
